Underperforming metrics: evaluation score 2.8/5, student growth 38%, incomplete PD, 85% attendance, and documented attendance policy violations.

Low evaluation score (2.7) and student growth (40%) suggest teacher would be better suited for general education rather than specialized humanities program.

priority_hiring_needs.justification: Potential non-renewal of Robert Chen (T118) and reassignment of Amanda Miller (T298) from Humanities creates critical need for qualified English teachers.
Potential non-renewal of Nicole White (T401) and reassignment of Michael Brown (T287) from STEM Focus creates staffing gap in mathematics.
Potential non-renewal of Thomas Smith (T205) creates need for additional science teacher, especially with STEM Academy implementation.

staffing_plan.rationale: Required leadership position to oversee program implementation and coordinate all STEM initiatives.
Two full-time mathematics teachers needed to cover all grade levels and specialized STEM math curriculum.
Two full-time science teachers required to cover biology, chemistry, physics, and environmental science courses.
One technology teacher needed to teach computer science, programming, and digital applications courses.
One engineering teacher required to develop and teach engineering design courses and oversee projects.
One instructional paraprofessional needed to support lab activities and provide individualized student assistance.
Half-time counselor position to provide specialized guidance for STEM pathways and college/career planning.

budget_allocation.adjustments_needed: Full implementation of staffing plan would cost $523,000 for personnel, exceeding the $360,000 personnel budget. Must phase in positions or reduce FTEs for initial implementation.

implementation_timeline.action_items: Finalize job descriptions and post all STEM Academy positions through district HR system.
Screen applications for minimum qualifications and create shortlist of candidates for interviews.
Conduct initial interviews with qualified candidates for all STEM positions.
Conduct follow-up interviews with top candidates, including teaching demonstrations.
Select final candidates for all positions and prepare offer packages.
Distribute and collect signed contracts from all new STEM Academy staff.
Conduct specialized orientation for STEM Academy staff on program goals and curriculum.
Begin STEM Academy classes with new staff and student cohort.
